know_more: She is singular so use DOESN'T not don't!
Cats is plural so use ARE not is!
Use HE for subject (doing action). HIM is for objects.
Past tense of see is SAW. Seen needs have/had before it.
They is plural so use WERE not was!
She/He/It needs an S on the verb! She RUNS.
ITS (no apostrophe) = belonging to it. IT'S = it is.
Everyone is singular! Use HAS not have.

text1: She speaks more louder than him.
know_more: Never use MORE with -ER words. Just LOUDER not more louder!

text1: Between you and I this is wrong.
know_more: Between you and ME. Object pronouns after prepositions!

text1: The team are playing good today.
know_more: WELL is the adverb. GOOD is an adjective. Playing WELL!

text1: If I was you I would leave now.
know_more: If I WERE you - subjunctive mood for hypotheticals!

text1: The number of students have increased.
know_more: The NUMBER (singular) HAS increased. Numbers HAVE...

text1: Whom is responsible for this mess?
know_more: WHO for subjects (doing action). WHOM for objects.

text1: She lay the book on the table.
know_more: LAY needs an object (lay something). Past tense is LAID.
Nouns are people places things or ideas. Dog is a thing!
Verbs are action words - what you DO. Run is an action!
Adjectives describe nouns. Beautiful flower - beautiful is adjective!
Adverbs describe verbs (how you do things). Run QUICKLY!
Happiness is a thing (an idea/feeling) so its a noun!
Think is what your brain DOES - its an action verb!
Enormous describes size. Enormous elephant - its an adjective!
-LY ending usually means adverb! Silently describes HOW.
Freedom is an idea/concept - abstract noun!
Discover is what scientists DO - its an action verb!
Mysterious describes something. The mysterious box!
Communicate is an action - something you DO with others!
Extremely modifies adjectives/adverbs. Extremely fast!
Achievement is a thing you earn - its a noun!
Brilliant describes someone/something. A brilliant idea!
Questions need question marks! They ask something.
Statements (telling facts) end with periods.
Exclamations show strong feelings! Use exclamation marks!
Where When What Why How = question words need ?
Commands can use ! for urgency or . for calm commands.

text1: The cat sat on the mat
know_more: This tells us something happened - its a statement (.)
Strong emotion about beauty - use exclamation mark!
Asking for help = question. Needs ?
Reporting what happened = statement. Ends with period.
What a... shows strong feeling = exclamation!
Have you...? Is asking - needs question mark!
Strong disbelief = strong emotion = exclamation!
Giving information calmly = statement with period.
Urgent warning command - exclamation mark!
Did she...? = question asking for yes/no answer.
Past tense adds -ED for regular verbs. Walk → Walked!
Present tense for he/she adds -S. He walks every day.
Future tense uses WILL + verb. Will walk tomorrow.
Run is irregular! Past = RAN not runned.
He/She RUNS every morning. Add -S for present.
Eat is irregular. Past = ATE. Yesterday I ate pizza.
Tomorrow I WILL EAT breakfast. WILL + base verb.
Write → Wrote (past). Irregular verb!
Sing → Sang (past). She sang beautifully yesterday.
Swim → Swam (past). We swam in the pool.
Think → Thought. Irregular - memorize it!
Speak → Spoke (past). He spoke to the class.
Bring → Brought. Similar to think → thought!
Teach → Taught. The teacher taught math.
Catch → Caught. I caught the ball yesterday.
Synonyms mean the SAME thing! Happy = Joyful.
Big and Large mean the same - both describe size!
Fast and Quick both mean speedy!
Smart = Intelligent = Clever. All mean brainy!
Beautiful and Gorgeous both mean very pretty!
Begin and Start mean the same - to commence!
Brave = Courageous = Fearless. Same meaning!
Calm and Peaceful both mean tranquil and quiet.
Difficult = Hard = Challenging. Same meaning!
Enormous = Huge = Gigantic. All mean very big!
Ancient means very very old - from long ago!
Purchase is a fancy word for buy!
Vanish = Disappear. Both mean go away suddenly!
Wealthy = Rich = Affluent. Having lots of money!
Rapid = Swift = Fast = Quick. All mean speedy!
Antonyms are OPPOSITES! Happy ↔ Sad.
Big is the opposite of Small!
Fast ↔ Slow. Complete opposites!
Hot and Cold are temperature opposites!
Light ↔ Dark. Day vs Night!
Old ↔ New. Ancient ↔ Modern.
Love is strong positive feeling. Hate is the opposite!
Begin/Start ↔ End/Finish.
Easy ↔ Difficult/Hard.
Rich ↔ Poor. Having money vs not having money.
Brave (facing fear) ↔ Cowardly (running from fear).
Smooth ↔ Rough. Think of textures!
Ancient (very old) ↔ Modern (current/new).
Generous (giving) ↔ Selfish (keeping for yourself).
Humble (modest) ↔ Proud (thinking highly of self).

text2: Emma found a small puppy in the park. It was brown with white spots and looked hungry. She gave it her sandwich and the puppy wagged its tail.
category: Where did Emma find the puppy?
know_more: Read carefully! The story says in the park.

text2: Emma found a small puppy in the park. It was brown with white spots and looked hungry. She gave it her sandwich and the puppy wagged its tail.
know_more: Look for color words - brown with white spots!

text2: Emma found a small puppy in the park. It was brown with white spots and looked hungry. She gave it her sandwich and the puppy wagged its tail.
category: What did Emma give the puppy?
know_more: She GAVE it her sandwich - giving means sharing!

text2: Tom made a volcano for the science fair. He used baking soda and vinegar to make it erupt. Everyone clapped and he won second place.
know_more: His project was a VOLCANO that erupted!

text2: Tom made a volcano for the science fair. He used baking soda and vinegar to make it erupt. Everyone clapped and he won second place.
know_more: Baking soda + vinegar = chemical reaction = eruption!

text2: Sarah wanted to play outside but it was raining. She built a blanket fort with her brother. They read books until the rain stopped.
know_more: Look for the reason - IT WAS RAINING!

text2: Sarah wanted to play outside but it was raining. She built a blanket fort with her brother. They read books until the rain stopped.
know_more: She BUILT a blanket fort - building with blankets!

text2: Sarah wanted to play outside but it was raining. She built a blanket fort with her brother. They read books until the rain stopped.
know_more: WITH her brother means he helped!

text2: Jake went to the library with his grandmother. He found a book about dinosaurs and the librarian helped him check it out.
know_more: The first sentence tells us - the LIBRARY!

text2: Jake went to the library with his grandmother. He found a book about dinosaurs and the librarian helped him check it out.
know_more: He found a book ABOUT DINOSAURS!

text2: Mom baked a cake for Dads birthday. She used chocolate frosting. When Dad came home he was surprised and happy.
know_more: Mom BAKED a CAKE - look for the action and object!

text2: Mom baked a cake for Dads birthday. She used chocolate frosting. When Dad came home he was surprised and happy.
know_more: Look for feeling words - SURPRISED and HAPPY!

text1: Maria grabbed her umbrella before leaving the house.
text2: What can you infer about the weather?
know_more: Umbrella = expecting rain! Good inference!

text1: The boys eyes grew wide when he opened the present.
know_more: Eyes growing wide = surprise or excitement!

text1: Sarah yawned and rubbed her eyes during the movie.
text2: What can you infer about Sarah?
know_more: Yawning + rubbing eyes = signs of being tired!

text1: The dog wagged its tail and jumped when Tom came home.
know_more: Wagging tail + jumping = dog is happy and excited!

text1: Mom put on her apron and took out flour and eggs.
text2: What is Mom going to do?
know_more: Apron + flour + eggs = baking ingredients!

text1: The students cheered when teacher said no homework.
know_more: Cheering = celebrating = happy about no homework!

text1: Dad put on his coat and grabbed car keys.
text2: What is Dad about to do?
know_more: Coat + car keys = going somewhere by car!

text1: The flowers were drooping and the soil was dry.
know_more: Drooping + dry soil = thirsty plants need water!

text1: Lisa smiled and hugged grandma at the airport.
know_more: Smiling + hugging = happy to see grandma!

text1: The baby cried when loud thunder boomed.
know_more: Loud sounds can scare babies - the thunder frightened the baby!

text1: Sam practiced piano two hours daily for a month.
text2: What can you infer about Sam?
know_more: Practicing a lot = dedicated = wants to get better!

text1: The bird built a nest and gathered twigs.
text2: What is the bird preparing for?
know_more: Nest building = preparing for eggs and baby birds!

text1: Everyone sang Happy Birthday to Emma.
know_more: Happy Birthday song = birthday celebration!

text1: The doctor gave Amy a bandage for her knee.
know_more: Bandage on knee = knee injury or scrape!

text1: Empty cookie jar sat on counter with crumbs.
know_more: Empty jar + crumbs = cookies were eaten!

text1: The boy run to school every day.
know_more: He/She/It needs -s! The boy RUNS.

text1: We was going to the park.
know_more: We is plural so use WERE not was!
Use SHE for subject. HER is for objects.
Always put the other person first! John and I.

text1: This is the most biggest house.
know_more: Never use MOST with -EST! Just BIGGEST.
SHE and I are friends. SHE for subjects!

text1: Neither of the boys are ready.
know_more: NEITHER is singular! Use IS not are.
DATA is plural! Use ARE. Datum is singular.
SHE and I went shopping. Subject pronouns!
Jump is an action - what you DO!
Happy describes feelings. A happy child!
Slowly tells HOW. Walk slowly. -LY = adverb!
Teacher is a person - that's a noun!
Bright describes light. A bright star!
Happily tells HOW you do something. -LY ending!
Imagination is an idea/concept - abstract noun!
Fascinate is what interesting things DO to you!
Carefully describes HOW. Drive carefully!
Commands with urgency use exclamation marks!
Simple statement = period at the end!
Asking if someone is okay = question mark!
Polite command can use period for calm tone!
Which = question word needs question mark!
Excitement about rainbow = exclamation!
Why = asking for reason = question mark!
Expression of pain = strong feeling = exclamation!
Stating a fact calmly = period!
Past tense: add -ED. Jump → Jumped!
She/He PLAYS. Add -S for present with he/she/it!
Future: WILL + verb. Will talk tomorrow!
Go is irregular! Past = WENT not goed!
Make → Made (past). Irregular verb!
See → Saw (past). I saw a bird yesterday!
Fly → Flew. The bird flew away!
Buy → Bought. She bought milk yesterday!
Fight → Fought. They fought bravely!
Tiny and Small both mean very little!
Sad = Unhappy = Sorrowful. Same meaning!
Shout and Yell both mean speak loudly!
Error = Mistake = Wrong. All mean not correct!
Sleepy = Tired = Drowsy. Need rest!
Scared = Afraid = Frightened. All mean fearful!
Complete = Finish = Conclude. All mean done!
Discover = Find = Uncover. All mean locate!
Genuine = Real = Authentic. Not fake!
Up ↔ Down. Opposite directions!
Day (light) ↔ Night (dark)!
Happy ↔ Sad. Opposite emotions!
Empty (nothing) ↔ Full (filled)!
Strong ↔ Weak. Opposite strengths!
Friend (ally) ↔ Enemy (foe)!
Increase (more) ↔ Decrease (less)!
Victory (win) ↔ Defeat (loss)!
Accept (take) ↔ Reject (refuse)!

text2: Maria wanted a pet. Her parents took her to the animal shelter. She chose a small orange kitten named Whiskers.
category: Where did Maria get her pet?
know_more: The story says they went to the ANIMAL SHELTER!

text2: Maria wanted a pet. Her parents took her to the animal shelter. She chose a small orange kitten named Whiskers.
know_more: The kitten's name is WHISKERS!

text2: Maria wanted a pet. Her parents took her to the animal shelter. She chose a small orange kitten named Whiskers.
know_more: Look for the color word - ORANGE kitten!

text2: Tom planted tomato seeds in his garden. He watered them every day. After two months small red tomatoes grew.
know_more: He planted TOMATO seeds!

text2: Tom planted tomato seeds in his garden. He watered them every day. After two months small red tomatoes grew.
know_more: The story says EVERY DAY!

text2: Tom planted tomato seeds in his garden. He watered them every day. After two months small red tomatoes grew.
know_more: AFTER TWO MONTHS they grew!

text2: Anna practiced violin for months. On concert night she played beautifully. The audience clapped for five minutes.
know_more: She practiced and played the VIOLIN!

text2: Anna practiced violin for months. On concert night she played beautifully. The audience clapped for five minutes.
know_more: She practiced FOR MONTHS!

text2: Anna practiced violin for months. On concert night she played beautifully. The audience clapped for five minutes.
know_more: They clapped for FIVE MINUTES!

text1: Tom put on sunscreen before going outside.
know_more: Sunscreen protects from sun = sunny day expected!
Turning on heater = trying to warm up = cold!

text1: The kids wore costumes and went trick-or-treating.
know_more: Costumes + trick-or-treating = Halloween!

text1: Dad packed suitcases and called a taxi.
know_more: Packing + taxi = traveling somewhere!

text1: Students put books away when bell rang.
know_more: Putting books away at bell = class ending!

text1: The ice cream melted on the sidewalk.
know_more: Ice cream melting = hot temperature outside!

text1: The library was quiet and everyone whispered.
know_more: Libraries require quiet - that's why whispers!

text1: Chef tasted the soup and added more salt.
know_more: Adding salt = soup needed more salt flavor!

text1: Bird gathering worms in its beak repeatedly.
know_more: Gathering food repeatedly = feeding baby birds!
